name: Colours.css
tagline: An Easy Way to Colour Your Website - 146 Web Colours in a single CSS Stylesheet with easy usage
body:
Colours.css

An Easy Way to Colour Your Website
146 Web Colours in a single CSS Stylesheet with easy usage

Usage

To use colours.css in your website, simply put the colours.css stylesheet in your css folder and link the stylesheet into your document's `head` tag: Now choose the colour you want and where you want to use it either with some text or in background. For example:

Using For Text:

If you choose white colour and want to use it for text:

This is a H1 Tag in White colour

or another way is:

This is a H1 Tag in White colour

Using For Background:

If you choose white colour and want to use it for background:
This is a background in White colour
or another way is:
This is a background in White colour

Using For Both Text & Background:

If you choose white colour for text and black colour for background:

This is a H1 Tag in White colour

or another way is:

This is a H1 Tag in White colour

> **You can use Colours.css wherever you want to use colours in your website.**
Colours.css is the New Easy Way to Colour Your Website

Colours Table Usage Description

| Colour Names | Using For Text (Put in Class Tag) | Using For Background (Put in Class Tag) | |
